meanings.sent1: The Riggs family had a big reunion last weekend.
meanings.sent2: Mr. Riggs is my neighbor and a very kind man.
meanings.sent3: Why did the Riggs family bring so many pies to the picnic?
meanings.sent4: The Riggs surname is well-known in this small town.
meanings.sent5: The Riggs name has been passed down for generations.

meanings.sent1: The fishermen took the riggs out to sea early in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The riggs were painted in bright colors to be easily spotted.
meanings.sent3: The riggs bobbed up and down on the waves like colorful toys.
meanings.sent4: The riggs lined up along the shore, ready for a day of fishing.
meanings.sent5: The riggs were filled with nets and fishing gear.

meanings.sent1: He tried to riggs the game by changing the rules secretly.
meanings.sent2: The company was accused of riggsing the competition to win the contract.
meanings.sent3: She always tries to riggs situations to her advantage.
meanings.sent4: The politician was caught riggsing the election results.
meanings.sent5: It's not fair to riggs the outcome in your favor.

meanings.definition: A slang term for a person's clothing or outfit
meanings.sent1: She wore a stylish riggs to the party last night.
meanings.sent2: His riggs were mismatched but somehow looked cool.
meanings.sent3: Why are you wearing such fancy riggs to the park?
meanings.sent4: Her riggs always stand out in a crowd.
meanings.sent5: He changed his riggs three times before deciding on an outfit.
